revised_title: Obituary of William Watson: A Pioneering Physicist and War Hero
tldr: This obituary honors the life and work of William Watson, a renowned physicist who made significant contributions to the fields of terrestrial magnetism, color vision, and gas warfare during World War I. Watson's expertise and dedication to his work led him to design innovative instruments and devices that advanced scientific research and helped protect the British Army from poison gas. His textbooks on physics were widely popular and influential in the scientific community.
